title: How to Make Soy Patties

steps.headline: Make the soybean pulp.
steps.description: Soak the beans in water for a minimum of 3 hours. Boil the soaked beans for 15 minutes in a large, heavy-based saucepan. Drain the water and mash the beans in a blender until they are thoroughly combined. The soybean pulp is ready when the beans are blended into a stiff puree. Add water as needed during the blending process.

steps.headline: Mix all the ingredients together apart from the breadcrumbs.
steps.description: Mix until a thick mixture forms.

steps.headline: Roll each patty in the breadcrumbs until coated.
Bake or fry the patties.
steps.description: If you choose to bake the patties, they will cook in an oven at 350ºF/177ºC until brown. If frying, keep an eye on the patties and turn over when each side browns. Best fried over a low heat to prevent burning.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: They go well with sauce and salad. Perfect for breakfast, brunch, dinner and supper!

tyn: Mixing bowl (clean the soaking bowl to reuse if wished)
Baking dish/tray covered in baking paper or greased or a frying pan
text: Make the soybean pulp. Soak the beans in water for a minimum of 3 hours. Boil the soaked beans for 15 minutes in a large, heavy-based saucepan. Drain the water and mash the beans in a blender until they are thoroughly combined. The soybean pulp is ready when the beans are blended into a stiff puree. Add water as needed during the blending process. Mix all the ingredients together apart from the breadcrumbs. Mix until a thick mixture forms. Shape into evenly sized patties.  Roll each patty in the breadcrumbs until coated.  Bake or fry the patties. If you choose to bake the patties, they will cook in an oven at 350ºF/177ºC until brown. If frying, keep an eye on the patties and turn over when each side browns. Best fried over a low heat to prevent burning. Serve. They go well with sauce and salad. Perfect for breakfast, brunch, dinner and supper!
